The claim being analyzed is whether Wisc: s governor's proposed cuts to perquisites would still leave public employees better off than their private sector counterparts.
The expert: s verdict is based on a fact-check conducted by PolitiFact Wisconsin, which examined the claim made by George Will during a round-table discussion on ABC's This Week.
PolitiFact Wisconsin found that a Kaiser: both public and private, pay an average of 29 percent of the cost of health insurance premiums. Among just state and government workers nationwide, the average was 25 percent for family coverage.
Additionally: a U.S. Bureau of Labor Statistics 2010 health care benefits survey was referenced, which indicated that the average employee contribution towards health care premiums was 25 percent for state and government workers.
